definitions.definition: openly refusing to obey somebody/something, sometimes in an aggressive way

examples.text: She had suddenly turned into a defiant teenager.
The terrorists sent a defiant message to the government.
He had a slightly defiant air.
Sylvia tossed back her dark hair in a gesture that was openly defiant.
He was in a defiant mood, unwilling to give way to anyone.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from French défiant or directly from defiance.
